thread.title: One Powerball — WA’s $50 million winner |
thread.title_full: One Powerball — WA’s $50 million winner | The Courier-Mail

author: couriermail.com.au
title: One Powerball — WA’s $50 million winner |
text:
The winner may not even know they are a multi-millionaire and Lotterywest aren’t giving too much away, to protect the identity of the lucky ticketholder.
The massive, game-changing sum is the biggest single Division 1 prize in the state’s history.
Lotterywest confirmed that the sole Division 1 winning ticket in Thursday night’s draw was sold in the Perth metropolitan area, making it the largest ever win in the state.
The magic numbers were: 3, 9, 27, 32, 25, 21 and the Powerball 18.
It was also confirmed the ticket was not a syndicate, and is not registered with LotteryWest.
The win rewrites the Lotto history books in WA — the previous high for a Division win in WA was $30 million, which has been won four times, most recently in May.
A Lotterywest spokeswoman said the exact location where the winning ticket was sold is not being disclosed to protect the winner.
She confirmed the winning ticket was not a syndicate, but a single ticket.
“We’re very excited,’’ she said.
WA's made history taking out tonight's $50M #PowerballWA jackpot! The largest Lotto prize won in the State #winnerWA pic.twitter.com/SS1zhHS5tp
— Lotterywest (@lotterywest) July 23, 2015 Lotterywest CEO Paul Andrew said it was an exciting moment for WA.
“We’re absolutely thrilled with tonight’s result which has rewritten WA’s history books,” Mr Andrew said.
“This win does not only hold an incredible $50 million prize, it’s also our 50th Division 1 Lotto winner for this year.”
If you didn’t quite hit the jackpot, don’t tear up that ticket yet — two players in WA also won a share of the Division 2 prize, worth almost $75,000.
A Lotterywest spokeswoman said it was still early days in the wait for a Division 1 winner.
“It’s still very early days, but we’re encouraging people who think they might have the winning ticket to contact Lotterywest,” she said.
As part of Lotterywest protocol, Division 1 winners must go through a face-to-face meeting before they can claim their prize.
They are then ushered into a “winner’s room’’ and met by a member of the customer services staff, who verifies the ticket and explains payment options.
The jackpot is tax-free — only the interest earned on top is taxable.
It remains to be seen whether the winner will identify themselves.
The spokeswoman said the “beauty of WA lottery” was that “winners can remain as anonymous as they want”.
Winners are also provided with a booklet that provided important information on how to deal with the new-found money.
“We see ourselves at Lotterywest not telling people how to spend their money, but helping them be equipped,” the spokeswoman said.
Originally published as One ball changes it all to tune of $50m
